column4: Enter a year or a historical period keyword to which the data relate. Examples: 1595; Renaissance
State the organisation or individual that is holder of the intellectual property rights. For datasets, these rights are usually vested in the organisation that employs the data creator(s).
DANS needs to know whether your dataset contains personal data in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
Specify which language was used to describe this dataset
Use autocomplete to select the scientific disciplines to which the dataset is relevant.
Use autocomplete to add the dataset to the collection of all datasets from a certain organisation.
Enter the details of a related dataset or other source

Specify the type of relation between the current dataset and the related source. See https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/rdf-relation-types/, use 'Relation' if the relation type cannot be described with any of the other available qualifiers.
Enter the title of the related dataset or other source
Enter the hyperlink of the related dataset or other source. Use a Persistent Identifier when possible.
A key term from the European Language Social Science Thesaurus (ELSST) that describes an important aspect of the Dataset.
Indicates a broad, important topic selected from the CESSDA Topic Classification that the Dataset covers.
